channel.title: Lost a book
channel.description: I lost a 90 dollar (ripoff..) book from a web design class and I can't complete the class without the book because the majority of the work is done out of the book. I was hoping somebody could point me to a free download of it. The book is: https://www.cengagebrain.com/shop/en/US/storefront/US?cmd=CLHeaderSearch&fieldValue=1-4239-0550-4

item.title: Lost a book
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

What a horrible curriculum.

Read full topic

item.title: Lost a book
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:13, topic:382673”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=478465.msg3503490#msg3503490 date=1297953844]

Buy them for $10 and sell them for $50 to people who would potentially buy from school.

Haha, doesn’t sound like a bad idea.

You’d regret not doing it. I’ve done similar business a few times. Just don’t let anyone know where you buy from or how much it costs you.
[/quote]

How would I go about advertising that?[/quote]

Experiment. Just go to the next year’s students and ask them if they’re interested in the book for $50 brand new which the school sells for $90. Usually it would be the smarter and less pretentious people who would purchase, also people who are the least well-off in your school are likely candidates.

Read full topic

item.title: Lost a book
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:7, topic:382673”]+ you payed $90 for it?

amazon.com

Could just pick one up for $4 here[/quote]

Wow I can’t believe my school charged me that fucking much when people are selling it for < 10 dollars. I’ll just buy a new one and rage over my misfortune of spending 90 dollars on the old one… Thanks again.

Read full topic

rep++ thanks man
